summary: Federal agencies reported operating 5,916 data centers in 2018. As part of IT acquisition reform efforts, an Office of Management and Budget initiative seeks to reduce data center duplication and costs by, for example, using servers more efficiently. All of the 24 participating agencies in 2020 reported progress meeting OMB's goals: They expected to close 230 centers and save $1.1 billion over 2 years. In...
title: Data Center Optimization: Agencies Report Progress and Billions Saved, but OMB Needs to Improve Its Utilization Guidance
